page.title: 01AREA OF MARSKE-IN-SWALEDALE.
page.content: The area includes parts of Marske, Downholme & Marrick parishes. It was part of Marske Estate centered on Marske Hall.{Rainfall}- 40 ins. Fairly dry summers.{Winters}- 5mths. Heavy snowfalls, frosts into May.{Rock} mainly limestone with a layer of peat on highest parts.{CLINTS}-small hamlet-7 residential dwellings and Methodist Chapel.{MARSKE VILLAGE}-2 farms & 16 residences, sub post office/shop, telephone box, St Edmunds Church and Graveyard.{MARSKE HALL}& ornamental grounds, orignal shooting lodge is now converted into flats. {PARISH CHURCH}of Downholme-St Michaels.{SKELTON HALL}-unfinished country mansion converted into 4 houses.{STABLE BLOCK}of hall bought by village-used for village functions & HQ of Swaledale Fell Resuce Service
